intro: Garnotia longiaristata var. basilanensis, commonly known as the Basilan garnet, is a rare flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as mountainous regions and forest understories. Its leaves are elliptical and have a smooth texture, while its stems are slender and often covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
